abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Sergipe Development
            through Inclusion Project for Brazil were as follows:
            outcomes were moderately satisfactory, risk to development
            outcome was moderate, Bank performance was moderately
            satisfactory, and Borrower performance was moderately
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: reform
            processes require a long-term commitment and have a steep
            learning curve, especially at their onset. The experience of
            the State of Sergipe indicates that there is no unique
            template of processes and institutions for a successful
            management model. Actions that depend on the coordination
            with other levels of the government require special
            attention. The challenge will be for the Bank to find an
            appropriate manner to disseminate the case of Sergipe more
            broadly and replicate this experience effectively elsewhere,
            taking into account the dissimilarities between the states
            as they relate to size, economic profile, and population.
